creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: snowy mountain peak with pink colors; pinkish-purple sky; blue-lavender colors behind foreground trees and rooftops
inscription: Left: [早春の安曇野] {Sōshun no Azumino} (Azumino in early spring); bottom, in pencil: [Toshi Yoshida], in black: [1989]
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Early Spring in Azumino
